title: Columbia Crest 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine was fermented in concrete and neutral barrels and aged on lees for 20 months. Its light herb and citrus aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate that's tart, bracing and white grapefruit-like. With acidity like this, it absolutely needs food. Oysters would make an excellent pairing.

title: Contini 2016 Nieddera Rosato (Valle del Tirso)
description: Savory and bright, this enticing rosato opens with aromas of red berry, tangerine and peach. The vibrant, enjoyable palate doles out wild cherry, strawberry and baking spice alongside crisp acidity.

title: Cricova 2013 Codru Dry Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Moldova)
description: A blend of 75% Cabernet Franc and 25% Merlot, this garnet-colored red has aromas of black currant, black plum and black berry. In the mouth, there are flavors of tart cherry pie and black raspberry. The tannins are pleasantly grippy on the midpalate and the finish is smooth.

title: Cristom 2015 Louise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This hails from the original block of the estate vineyard—a densely planted plot that delivers slightly leafy rhubarb and raspberry flavors year after year. The wine's green, herbal touches—perhaps the result of 43% whole cluster fermentation—gently fade out on the finish.

title: D'Orta - De Conciliis 2012 Zero Aglianico (Paestum)
description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of underbrush, black-skinned fruit and baking spice. The dense palate delivers prune, dried black cherry and vanilla, while dusty, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2022.

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2016 Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Waxy, muted floral tones perfume this glassy, light-footed dry Riesling. The palate is fruity but crisp, suggesting tart yellow plums and limes. The finish is lean and mineral-driven but persistent. Drink now through 2021.

title: Fitz-Ritter 2016 Dürkheimer Abtsfronhof Spätlese Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)
description: Gorgeous orange blossom, peach and pineapple abound in this classically perfumed Gewürztraminer. Semisweet on the palate and delightfully sprightly, it's a straightforward yet elegant apéritif. Drink now through 2020.

title: Goose Ridge 2016 Estate Bottled Ice Wine Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This ice wine—a rarity in the state—has dried pineapple, mango and honey aromas that haven't entirely melded. The palate, however, brings plenty of sugar-rich, honeyed papaya flavors backed by pleasant acidity. It may integrate with more time in bottle.

title: Gotas de Mar 2016 Godello (Ribeiro)
description: This chiseled Godello shows the fresh and pure side of this increasingly popular white grape. Aromas of citrus fruits and skins lead to a juicy, medium-bodied palate with good intensity. Light flavors of melon and citrus are steady on the finish.

title: Louis Jadot 2015  Marsannay
description: From the northernmost village on the Côte de Nuits, on the edge of the city of Dijon, this wine with its perfumed red cherries and ripe red berries is both structured and developing quickly and easily. Light tannins give shape to the generous fruit and good acidity. Drink this ripe, fruity wine from 2019.

title: Luigi Bosca 2015 Finca Los Nobles Chardonnay (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Barrel aromas are out front on the nose of this wine, with wood spice and apple notes. It's sturdy on the palate and resiny in flavor, with apple and pear notes lurking below. It remains oaky through the finish.

title: Mad Fish 2016 Chardonnay (Western Australia)
description: This is an aromatic, fruity, easygoing Chardonnay sourced from three main Western Australian wine regions: Margaret River, Geographe, and Great Southern. Waxy lemon and florals follow from the nose to the palate which finishes on notes of toast and white pepper spice.

title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)
description: Savory hints of pollen and earth juxtapose bright tangerine, lemon and apple in this dry Pinot Blanc. Light bodied and zesty in style, it's a rejuvenating sip with wide appeal. Drink now through 2019.

title: Montesco 2014 Punta Negra Pinot Noir (Tupungato)
description: A light color and equally light cinnamon and spiced raspberry aromas set this wine up for a racy, acid-driven palate. Its spicy, juicy plum and currant flavors finish tight and fresh, for an elegant, food-friendly package.

title: Montesole 2015 Spumante Brut Greco (Irpinia)
description: This crisp, delightful sparkler offers crunchy McIntosh apple, Bartlett pear and candied citrus-peel flavors. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, quenching finish while small, continuous bubbles lend finesse.

title: Pike Road 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine's strong mint scent catches your attention immediately, and that quality carries into the palate. Quince, pineapple and lemon flavors keep it interesting and on the light side of ripe. There's a touch of spice on the finish.

title: Raylee 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This affordable Oregon Pinot Noir has won multiple accolades, and for good reason. It's flavorful and well-balanced, with tart raspberry and black cherry flavors. It's backed by ample acidity and enough tannic weight to firm up the finish.

title: Salentein 2014 Single Vineyard San Pablo Estate Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Wood smoke and clove aromas are the main features in this wine's barrel-driven nose. Combine a high-elevation vineyard like San Pablo with 2014's cold conditions, and the result is a massive Malbec with hard edges. Its dark fruit flavors are muscular and downright abrasive on the finish. Drink or hold indefinitely.

title: Trabucchi d'Illasi 2010 San Colombano  (Valpolicella Superiore)
description: Made with 40% Corvina, 40% Corvinone, 5% Oseleta and 5% Croatina organic grapes, this opens with aromas of ripe, black-skinned berry and vanilla. The medium-bodied, savory palate offers black-cherry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Ty Caton 2014 Tytanium Caton Vineyard Red (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This multi-variety blend is made largely of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah, with smaller amounts of Syrah, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Boldly ripe, dry and tannic, its dense flavors are wrapped up in black currant, tree bark and cinnamon.

title: Viña Cobos 2014 Bramare Rebon Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: This wine's grapey aromas are compact, and toasty oak fills in the rest of the nose. The palate is abrupt, almost vertical, and firm to the extreme, with chewy black plum and black cherry flavors.

title: Viña Vilano 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Straightforward berry and cherry aromas control a nose with spice and cocoa notes. A high-toned, tannic palate carries fresh plum and raspberry flavors end, with hard tannins, barrel-based notes and general dryness. Drink through 2021.

title: Viñalba 2015 Reserva Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)
description: As this Malbec-Cabernet blend unfolds, its bright, fruity aromas grow darker and toastier. Although the palate feels pointy and tartaric, it tastes of bold, lemony berry fruits and shows some heat on the finish. Try it with everyday pastas, grilled meats and pizza.

title: Voyager Estate 2014 Chardonnay (Margaret River)
description: On the quiet side, this wine is light and lean, with delicate notes of stone fruit, blossoms and vanilla. The palate is more citrusy and slightly chalky in texture, with plenty of acidity and a floral finish. Drink now–2024.

title: Webster Cellars 2013 Left Bank Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 15% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Heavy on the palate, it has elements of black cherry, black licorice and sage that ride a velvety texture of rounded richness.

title: Clairault 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Margaret River)
description: Open and attractive, Clairault's red blend is a medley of bright raspberry fruit, flowers and herbs, all tied together by an elegant, medium body, juicy red fruit and savory notes on the palate.

title: D'Arenberg 2014 d'Arry's Original Shiraz-Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: A little reductive at first, this Shiraz and Grenache blend opens to reveal the character of both grape varieties: dark cherry, strawberry, smoked meat and herbs lead into a powerful, full-bodied palate that's oaky but balanced by plush fruit and fine grained tannins. Drink now–2025.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2016 Crater View Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Rogue Valley)
description: An interesting and unusual win from the Dobbes Family lineup, this boasts yellow and green fruit, with pineapple and lemon curd accents. There's a streak of orange marmalade also, and plenty of tart acid.

title: Domaine Changarnier 2015 Pierrefitte  (Monthélie)
description: This wine is ripe and smoothly fruity. From a parcel close to Volnay, it is sumptuous, full with layers of red fruits and a generous richness. The acidity is just right to give the wine its shape, aided by the light tannic structure. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Chopin et Fils 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: This wine has a smoky aroma from wood aging. The wood also shows on the palate but does not mask the bright cherry fruit. With its solid core, the wine is rich and likely to age well. Drink from 2020.
